Question
========

There are two tests designed to determine whether a person has Prodlaws psychosis. One is measured with values between 0 and 200 and the other with values between 0 and 1. The researcher then calculates then a z-score of each of the outcomes of the two tests. She does this to compare the outcomes of the two tests. She can do this because

Answerlist
----------

* Z-scores are percentages.
* Z-scores have a mean of 0 and a standard deviation of 1.
* Z-scores make the variables dependent.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* Z-scores percentages are: Incorrect
* Z-scores have a mean of 0 and a standard deviation of 1: Correct
* Z-scores make the variables dependent...: Incorrect
